page.title: 12Ecology: Mammals
page.content: At Beck Mill there are many different kinds of mammals;hares,roe deer,foxes, red squirrels and rabbits. The hares can be seen in open grass- land where they feed,and in long,thick grass and trees where they live. It is not unusual to see six together. Rabbits live in similar habitat but they like soft,sandy places for their warrens. Roe deer like thick woodland for cover and privacy but more open land to feed on grass and leaves. The squirrels of this area are red. They like privacy so they are not often seen.They have a dray made of sticks and twigs in a deciduous tree. Foxes of this area, although rarely seen, are usually red. They appear singly, living in thick undergrowth, eating rabbits.
